div.h2: SASD Closed for Remainder of 2019-2020 School Year

div.div:
UPDATE: Gov. Evers announced that he has extended the Safer at Home order to 8 a.m. Tuesday, May 26 which includes the closure of all public and private K-12 school buildings for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. Virtual learning will continue through June 11.
Read More >

td.h2: Updates on School Closing, Online Education and Parent Resources

td.h3: School Buildings Closed Remainder of 2019-2020 School Year
td.p: Gov. Evers announced today that he has extended the Safer at Home order from April 24 to 8 a.m. Tuesday, May 26 — or until a superseding order is issued. This order also includes the closure of all public and private K-12 school buildings for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year.
It is important for us to support families by providing educational resources to be used while schools are closed. Our current Virtual Learning Plan will continue until the end of the school year.
Students will receive a packet of materials or an electronic device in order to access assignments from their teacher.

ul.li: Instruction and assignments will be provided via technology, physical materials, or both
Point of contact is your child’s classroom teacher
Classroom teachers will be reaching out to families approximately every 3 learning days
This is the first time we have sent digital devices home with our elementary students. Please be mindful of the care and cleaning of the device.

td.p: At the middle school level, schools will utilize an online template to share assignments with students. Assignments will be updated daily by 7:40 a.m.

ul.li: Link for accessing Virtual Learning Resources will be posted on the middle school website homepages: Farnsworth - Horace Mann - Urban - Etude Middle - Warriner
Assignments will be updated daily by 7:40 a.m.
The student’s point of contact remains the subject area teachers

td.p: At the high school level, students will access assignments through PowerSchool, Google Classroom, direct teacher email, or on Etude High School or Warriner High School

ul.li: Assignments will be updated daily by 8:00 a.m.
The students should work directly with the teachers for each subject area.

td.p: Teachers will be reaching out to their students and parents. Annual IEP meetings will be conducted as scheduled virtually or over the phone

ul.li: If you have questions or need help using your digital device, please use our Online Help Desk Request Form for parents and students. This form will also be linked on our District website homepage.
Free internet access is offered by Charter Communications. Call Charter at 1-844-488-8395 for more information.

td.p: The third quarter of school ended on Friday, April 3, and grades have now been posted in Skyward Family Access. No paper copies will be mailed. Because this has been a time of significant transition and adjustment, third quarter grades will only include work completed prior to school closure on March 17. This is the most equitable and accurate record of work completed, which can be used to fairly assign grades.

Please log in to your Skyward Family Access account and click on Portfolio in the left side menu to view report cards. Special Education I-6 Progress Reports can also be found in Skyward Family Access by clicking on Student Services in the left side menu, then click Display Options, choose View IEP with the correct dates, scroll down to IEP Forms and select the I-6 form.

View directions for how to locate report cards and I-6 forms. If you don’t remember your username or password, go to Skyward Family Access and click on ‘Forgot Your Login/Password?’ link on the login screen. If you need additional assistance, please email your school secretary.

p.a: Read the full letter sent April 14, 2020

ul.li: Free grab-and-go breakfast and lunch will be available for any child 18 years of age or younger to pick up while our schools are closed. The following schools will be offering meals at Cooper, Grant, Jackson, Jefferson, Longfellow, James Madison, Pigeon River, Sheridan, North and South
Parents or children may stop in anytime between 7:30 - 11:00 a.m. to pick up a breakfast and lunch meal at the main entrances of each school to take home. Students may not eat meals on site.
The Department of Public Instruction has revised its policy. Children DO NOT need to be present when picking up meals. Adults may pick up meals on behalf of their children. No identification needed.
Families can drive up to the school entrance for curbside pick up.

td.p: The Sheboygan Area School District will continue to observe Friday, April 10 and Monday, April 13 as planned. No virtual learning or grab-n-go meals will be offered on these No School Days.
During unprecedented times, it’s important that we support our students’ overall wellness and mental health. Review this resource of services and tips for student and family wellness.

ul.li: Follow school announcements on our Facebook and Twitter.
Families in need of community resources or support are encouraged to call Wisconsin 211 for assistance.

img.alt: How to Prevent the Spread of Germs

h3.b: Our Cleaning Measures and What You can Do

td.p: Sheboygan Area School District has a routine cleaning regimen in place to help reduce the spread of germs and communicable disease. In addition to our regular cleaning and disinfection, we are increasing the cleaning of high-touch areas and hard and soft surface items throughout the day. We will follow all guidelines of the CDC and our local and state health departments and use EPA approved products.
td.div: We all play a role in helping reduce the spread of communicable disease. We are asking our students, staff and families to practice regular preventive actions (see flyer in English, Spanish, Hmong and Mandarin Chinese) including:

ul.li: Wash your hands regularly, for 20 seconds, using soap and hot water. Make sure to wash your fingertips. This is especially important after using the restroom, coughing or sneezing into your hands, and before preparing or consuming food.
Avoid coughing or sneezing into your hands or in the air. Always try to cough or sneeze into a tissue, and then throw the tissue away. If you don’t have a tissue, cough/sneeze into your arm.
As much as you can, avoid touching your eyes, mouth and nose.

img.alt: How to Talk to Kids about Coronavirus

a.p: Click here to submit any questions you may have during the school closure.
Click here for directions on how to update your contact information for automated messages.
